description: Two explosive devices were discovered at the Seminole Hard Rock Casino in Tampa, Florida, on Sunday and Monday, prompting partial evacuations, the police said.
title: 2 "crude" explosive devices found at Seminole Hard Rock Casino in Tampa

description: Thousands of dockworkers at more than a dozen ports along the East Coast and Gulf Coasts are poised to walk off the job on Tuesday.
title: Dockworkers at East and Gulf Coast ports steaming toward a strike

description: Need help digging out of debt? Here are three smart debt relief moves to make this October.
title: 3 smart debt relief moves to make for October

description: Russia and Ukraine have been ramping up the use of drones since the war began more than two years ago. Ben Solomon, a senior video correspondent for the Wall Street Journal, joins CBS News with more on the evolution of drone use in the conflict.
title: How Russia, Ukraine use drones for war

description: As governor of Minnesota, Tim Walz created the largest state Child Tax Credit in the nation and raised taxes for high-income residents.
title: What are Tim Walz's economic policies? Here's a look at his record.

description: A Fulton County Superior Court judge has ruled Georgia's six-week abortion ban is unconstitutional. CBS News' Lindsey Reiser has the latest breaking news.
title: Georgia judge strikes down abortion ban

description: South Carolina officials, including Governor Henry McMaster, gave an update on Helene recovery efforts after the storm swept through the area causing catastrophic flooding and damage.
title: South Carolina officials on Helene recovery efforts

description: The ruling means abortions in Georgia will be permitted to take place up to around 22 weeks, instead of a much earlier limit.
title: Georgia's abortion ban ruled unconstitutional

description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Ohio Sen. JD Vance will debate Tuesday as the presidential election looms weeks away. CBS News senior White House and political correspondent Ed O'Keefe breaks down what's at stake for the Trump and Harris campaigns.
title: What's at stake for JD Vance, Tim Walz debate?

description: Ohio Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz will debate in New York City Tuesday, the only vice presidential debate likely to occur before the November election. CBS News' Lindsey Reiser breaks down the impact of past vice presidential debates on elections.
title: Can the Tim Walz, JD Vance debate shape the 2024 election?

description: Hurricane Helene's​ massive rains and flooding is a major health and safety risk for residents exposed to potential waterborne illnesses and other dangers.
title: The biggest health risks from Hurricane Helene flooding

description: Israeli ground operation in Lebanon looms; New evacuations as Line Fire flares up in California.
title: 9/30: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: A few different types of debts can be cleared by filing for bankruptcy, but does that include credit card debt?
title: Will filing for bankruptcy clear my credit card debt?

description: Former President Donald Trump visited Valdosta, Georgia, to assess the damage Helene left behind after making landfall in Florida as a Category 4 hurricane before it entered Georgia and caused widespread damage.
title: Trump visits Georgia to tour Helene damage

description: Watch "CBS Mornings Plus," with co-hosts Tony Dokoupil and Adriana Diaz from 9-10 a.m. ET/PT weekdays on CBS-owned stations in Los Angeles, Chicago, San Francisco, Detroit and Miami, and is simulcast on CBS News 24/7, CBS News' national, free streaming news network.
title: 9/30: CBS Mornings Plus

description: More than 40,000 U.S. dockworkers could walk off the job soon if their union doesn't reach an agreement over a new contract with the shipping industry. CBS News New York's Tim McNicholas reports.
title: How port strikes could impact America's supply chain

description: Interest rates on home equity products are falling. Here's the cheapest way to borrow $50,000 worth of equity now.
title: Is a $50,000 HELOC or home equity loan cheaper now?

description: The state and national Democratic Party said the rule might introduce "uncertainty" in vote tallying, and "wreak havoc on the general election."
title: Democrats sue to block Georgia election rule requiring hand count of ballots

description: Most voters say they plan to watch the VP debate between Tim Walz and JD Vance Tuesday night, which will be moderated by CBS News.
title: Views of Vance, Walz ahead of debate — CBS News poll

description: "Galaxy Gas" is a new spin on an old drug — nitrous oxide, also known as laughing gas or "whippets" — and it's taken over social media.
title: The "Galaxy Gas" trend whipping up controversy on social media

description: Israeli ground operation in Lebanon looms; New evacuations as Line Fire flares up in California.
title: 9/30: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: Watch "CBS Mornings Plus," with co-hosts Tony Dokoupil and Adriana Diaz from 9-10 a.m. ET/PT weekdays on CBS-owned stations in Los Angeles, Chicago, San Francisco, Detroit and Miami, and is simulcast on CBS News 24/7, CBS News' national, free streaming news network.
title: 9/30: CBS Mornings Plus

description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz and Ohio Sen. JD Vance are set to debate on CBS News Tuesday. Walz and Vance have been preparing for what could be the final debate before the presidential election in November. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more.
title: How Tim Walz, JD Vance are preparing to debate

description: Former President Donald Trump's personal attacks against Vice President Kamala Harris could impact moderate voters in key battleground states. CBS News political director Fin Gómez has more.
title: Trump's new Harris personal attack questions her mental fitness

description: Former President Donald Trump is visiting Valdosta, Georgia, and Vice President Kamala Harris is headed back to Washington D.C. early from Nevada as both presidential candidates monitor the worsening situations in states where Helene impacted communities. CBS News' Scott MacFarlane and Nidia Cavazos report.
title: How Trump, Harris are responding to Helene damage

description: Hannah Gutierrez-Reed sought to dismiss her conviction or convene a new trial in the shooting death, alleging misconduct and suppression of evidence by law enforcement.
title: "Rust" armorer's conviction upheld in fatal on set shooting by Alec Baldwin

description: Mortgage interest rates could still fall in October, even without a Fed meeting. Here's what could cause that drop.
title: What could make mortgage interest rates drop this October?

description: After surviving a 1990 bus crash that left her temporarily paralyzed, Gloria Estefan has donated over $42 million to paralysis research.
title: Gloria Estefan on how $42 million commitment to end paralysis began

description: An official tells CBS News that Israel has notified the U.S. of its intent to launch a limited ground incursion into Lebanon. The operation could begin within hours, the official said. CBS News contributor Sam Vinograd has the latest.
title: Israel notifies U.S. of intent to launch Lebanon ground incursion, official says

description: "The conduct of one Russian Su-35 was unsafe, unprofessional, and endangered all," a NORAD commander said.
title: Video shows Russian jet flying close to plane off Alaska: "Endangered all"

description: Consolidation could be the right approach to your credit card debt, but it depends on how much you owe.
title: How much credit card debt is too much to consolidate?

description: Here's a look at where Sen. JD Vance stands on several important issues heading into Tuesday's vice presidential debate, hosted by CBS News.

description: Here's a look at where Gov. Tim Walz stands on several important issues heading into Tuesday's vice presidential debate, hosted by CBS News.
title: What to know about Tim Walz's views and policy record before the VP debate

description: The Biden administration announced new regulations to shore up the partial asylum ban​ it enacted at the U.S. southern border in June.
title: Biden shores up asylum limits, likely extending border crackdown indefinitely

description: Ryan Wesley Routh, the suspect who allegedly plotted an assassination attempt in Florida against former President Donald Trump, pleaded not guilty to five counts against him Monday. CBS News' Cristian Benavides has the latest after Routh's court appearance.
title: Trump golf course assassination plot suspect pleads not guilty

description: Americans in the Southeast are digging out from Hurricane Helene's destruction and subsequent storm damages estimated to be in the billions of dollars. At least 100 have died as flooding, storm surges and other storm effects are being blamed for the growing death toll. CBS News' Skyler Henry and Nicole Valdes report.
title: Latest news on Hurricane Helene damage, storm recovery efforts

description: Opting for a HELOC has its benefits right now, but you should know what your monthly payments could be.
title: How much will a $100,000 HELOC cost monthly now that rates are falling?

description: Unpaid and underpaid labor prevails, an analysis of research by several NGO's found, including wage deductions, "significant" debt bondage and child labor.
title: Shrimp farmers, peelers in Asia exploited by U.S. supermarkets, analysis finds

description: Ryan Routh, who is accused of plotting to kill Donald Trump, appeared in a West Palm Beach federal court and pleaded not guilty to five counts.
title: Suspect in Trump golf course assassination attempt pleads not guilty

description: Catastrophic damage across Southeast in Helene's aftermath; Mail-in voting begins for South Florida voters.
title: 9/30: CBS News 24/7 Episode 1

description: President Biden said he expects he will need to ask Congress to pass supplemental funding to respond to the storm.
title: Biden plans to visit areas devastated by Helene "later this week"

description: CBS News contributor David Begnaud helped a woman find a nurse who cared for her while she battled an autoimmune condition decades ago.
title: Patient reunites with nurse who helped save her life 35 years ago

description: Verizon customers reported their mobile phone service wasn't working in cities across the U.S., giving them only SOS mode.
title: Verizon customers report widespread outages

description: There are five new stadium dates for next summer in Toronto, Chicago, New Jersey, Los Angeles and Mexico City.
title: Oasis announces North America reunion tour dates in 2025

description: President Biden provided an update Monday on the federal response to the devastating damage from Helene across the Southeast. Over 100 people have been killed by the storm and power is still out for many throughout the region. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more.
title: Biden gives update on Helene storm recovery, says he'll visit North Carolina

description: Acclaimed author Ta-Nehisi Coates joins "CBS Mornings" to talk about his new book, "The Message" and about the banning of his work in South Carolina.
title: Ta-Nehisi Coates on the power of stories, new book, "The Message"

description: After surviving a tour bus crash in 1990 that left her temporarily paralyzed, Gloria Estefan has donated more than $42 million to paralysis research. The Grammy-winning icon shares her passion for finding a cure.
title: Gloria Estefan on her more than 30-year fight to cure paralysis

description: The suspect in the second apparent assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump will be arraigned in a Florida courtroom Monday. Ryan Routh was already facing weapons charges, but has since been charged with trying to carry out the plot to shoot the former president. CBS News correspondent Cristian Benavides has more.
title: Suspect in 2nd Trump assassination attempt to be arraigned on new charges

description: Dikembe Mutombo, who was an eight-time NBA All-Star, was diagnosed with a brain tumor in 2022.
title: Dikembe Mutombo, NBA Hall of Famer, dies at 58

description: Coldplay's Chris Martin and Jonny Buckland add more in their "CBS Sunday Morning" conversation with Anthony Mason, discussing the success of their "Music of the Spheres" tour, their latest single, and why they plan to release only two more albums.
title: Coldplay on why they plan to release only two more albums

description: About 45,000 dockworkers at ports across the U.S. are poised to go on strike as they demand significantly higher wages and job protections from automation. Peter S. Goodman, global economic correspondent for the New York Times, joined CBS News to discuss the impending work stoppage.
title: What to know about looming U.S. port strike

description: North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper predicted the toll would rise as rescuers reached areas isolated by collapsed roads and widespread flooding.
title: North Carolina devastated by Helene: "Unprecedented tragedy"

description: Thirty-five years ago, Alyson Brittain overcame a rare autoimmune condition and credits her nurse Ceddie Persaud with saving her life. The two lost touch after Brittain left the hospital. Recently, Brittain stumbled upon a picture of her and Persaud together and decided she wanted to thank him. She reached out to CBS contributor David Begnaud for help
title: Patient reunites with nurse who helped her overcome rare condition 35 years ago

description: Ohio Senator JD Vance and Minnesota Governor Tim Walz are prepping for Tuesday night's vice presidential debate, the only debate scheduled between the two running mates. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has a preview of the matchup.
title: What to expect from VP debate between JD Vance, Tim Walz

description: With homes destroyed and entire communities isolated, residents of the Southeast United States face the aftermath of Hurricane Helene.
title: Hurricane Helene leaves over 100 dead, thousands unaccounted for in Southeast

description: The last coal-fired power plant in the U.K. is closing, ending Britain's 140-year reliance on the fossil fuel for electricity.
title: U.K. closing its last coal-fired power plant

description: "CBS Mornings Plus" co-hosts Tony Dokoupil and Adriana Diaz get personal about their lives off-air. From family values to career choices, they share a few fun and heartfelt details you may not know.
title: Getting to know "CBS Mornings Plus" co-hosts Tony Dokoupil and Adriana Diaz

description: Over 100 people are dead and Find Energy reports more than two million still had no electricity early Monday following Helene's destructive trek through the Southeast. CBS News correspondent Nicole Valdes reports on the aftermath and CBS News Philadelphia meteorologist Grant Gilmore has a look at the ongoing flooding threats for the region.
title: Millions still without power after Helene, damage in Southeast is catastrophic

description: Some Republicans are criticizing their nominee, former President Donald Trump, for name-calling his opponent, Vice President Kamala Harris, over the weekend on the campaign trail. Meanwhile, vice presidential candidates JD Vance and Tim Walz were also campaigning ahead of Tuesday's VP debate hosted by CBS News.
title: Trump's comments on Harris draw backlash as candidates campaign in battleground states

description: Israeli airstrikes hit Houthi targets over the weekend in Yemen after recent attacks on Israel. The Israeli military also said it bombed Hezbollah command centers in Lebanon. Dozens of people were killed, including Hezbollah's longtime leader.
title: Dozens killed in Lebanon attacks as Israel widens its strikes across the Middle East

description: Millions across the South are reeling from Helene's historic flooding. Also, Israel strikes targets in Yemen and Lebanon as the U.S. prepares for more escalations. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Millions across the South are impacted by the devastation of Helene

description: Aerospace engineer Emily Calandrelli joins "CBS Mornings Plus" to discuss how planes remain in the air, despite some scientific uncertainty. She also reveals details about her space-bound adventure and her "Stay Curious" book series.
title: Aerospace engineer Emily Calandrelli on the mysteries of flight, upcoming space trip

description: Experts see gold's price soaring in October, but market uncertainties could spark fluctuations. Here's what to know.
title: Here's the gold price forecast for October 2024

description: In today's "Mornings Memory," we revisit Ralph Lauren's decision to step down as CEO of his multi-billion-dollar company in 2015. Lauren remains a fashion icon, serving as executive chairman and outfitting Team USA at the Olympics.
title: Mornings Memory: A look back at Ralph Lauren's exit as CEO

description: With the rapid spread of AI-generated deepfakes, experts are sounding the alarm about their influence on society and elections. Laurie Segall, founder of Mostly Human Media, shares tips on how to spot what's real and what's not.
title: What to know about the rise of AI deepfakes

description: Austria's far-right Freedom Party won a national parliamentary election, but it will struggle to find other parties willing to form a coalition government.
title: Far-right party wins Austria election but faces hurdles to govern

description: As offshore markets boom with wagers on the Trump-Harris race, American companies are pushing to legalize election betting. John Aristotle Phillips, founder of political data analytics firm "Aristotle" and CEO of "PredictIt,"  discusses the potential impact on democracy and trust in the electoral process.
title: Expert weighs in on future of election betting

description: Thousands of people were evacuated Sunday when a chemical plant fire sent a large, hazardous plume of smoke into the air about 30 miles east of Atlanta. It's unclear when residents can return home.
title: Georgia chemical plant fire forces thousands of evacuations near Atlanta

description: Many of the convicted criminals described in a recent letter from ICE have been in the U.S. for a long time, before the Biden administration took office.
title: Trump, allies mischaracterize data on immigrants with criminal convictions

description: Thousands of dockworkers at 14 different ports from Texas to Massachusetts are set to go on strike at midnight. Negotiations between the unions representing the dockworkers and a shipping industry group have stalled with no talks currently scheduled to take place Monday. Ayelet Sheffey, senior economic policy reporter for Business Insider, joined CBS News to discuss the situation.
title: No negotiations scheduled as major port strike looms

description: Around the world, 2.6 billion people are not connected to the internet. Verizon's CEO Hans Vestberg talks with "CBS Mornings" about how his company along with the Edison Alliance, which Verizon co-founded, are working to bring digital access to communities in more than 100 countries.
title: Verizon CEO talks bridging the digital divide in over 100 countries

description: Iwao Hakamada, 88, was declared innocent of the quadruple murder that he spent 46 years on death row for.
title: Longest-serving death row inmate speaks out after murder acquittal

description: CBS News will host the only vice presidential debate Tuesday between Democratic Governor Tim Walz and Republican Senator JD Vance. As the two running mates prepare, Vice President Kamala Harris is renewing her calls for another debate with former President Donald Trump. CBS News' Zak Hudak and Aaron Navarro have more.
title: Walz and Vance gear up for VP debate, Harris continues push for second debate with Trump

description: Depending on your needs, one might be a better choice than the other right now. Here's what you should know.
title: Does a HELOC or a home equity loan make more sense right now?

description: Israel has increased its strikes on Iranian proxies following a weekend strike that killed Hezbollah's leader, Hassan Nasrallah. CBS News foreign correspondent Chris Livesay has more on the escalating situation from northern Israel, where the IDF is massing tanks and armored vehicles near the country's border with Lebanon.
title: Israel expands strikes on Iran proxies, building up military presence near Lebanon border

description: More than 100 people are dead after Helene swept through the southern U.S., with officials calling the flood damage in the Carolinas "biblical." CBS News' Nicole Valdes and Skyler Henry have more.
title: Helene blamed for more than 100 deaths, "biblical" flood damage in the Carolinas

description: CBS News contributor and former national security adviser H.R. McMaster explains the latest on the conflict in the Middle East amid fears of a widening war and the U.S.' role.
title: What to know about Israel's strikes in the Middle East

description: Two Czech brothers allegedly ran a gang that forced 16 people into modern slavery, working at a McDonald's and other businesses in the U.K.
title: Victims of modern slavery forced to work in U.K. McDonald's, BBC finds

description: Hurricane Helene tore through almost 600 miles across multiple states after making landfall in Florida last week. The historic storm is responsible for at least 116 deaths, including 70 in the Carolinas.
title: Death toll from Hurricane Helene rises to over 100 as cleanup continues

description: Iran, which performs death sentences by hanging, rarely executes convicts in public.
title: Iran executes 2 men in public over killing of police officer

description: AT&T is selling its remaining 70% stake in DirecTV to private equity firm TPG a decade after agreeing to buy the satellite TV provider.
title: AT&T sells DirecTV as it bows out of the entertainment business

description: The vice-presidential showdown on Oct. 1 is expected to be the last debate before the November election.
title: Tim Walz and JD Vance's 2024 VP debate is tomorrow. Here's what to know.

description: Israel has killed many of Hezbollah's senior leaders with devastating strikes in Lebanon, but neither side appears ready to step back from the brink.
title: Despite devastating blows, Hezbollah says it's ready for war with Israel

description: The city on the border with Arizona has suffered years of violence between drug cartels fighting for control of the border crossing.
title: Drug cartel surveillance cameras found on palm trees near border

description: Outrage over how a man struck a wolf with a snowmobile, taped the injured animal's mouth shut and brought it into a bar has resulted in a proposal to tweak Wyoming's animal cruelty law.
title: Wyoming may tweak law allowing killing of wolves with vehicles

description: Democrats believe political newcomer Janelle Stelson, a longtime local TV anchor, may be able to unseat six-term GOP Rep. Scott Perry.
title: Democrats bullish about TV anchor's chances of unseating GOP Rep. Scott Perry

description: For nearly a century, Graffeo Coffee, a Bay Area institution, has been perfecting the traditional process of roasting the perfect coffee bean. Their goal is to help customers brew the perfect cup of joe. Itay Hod reports from San Francisco.
title: A San Francisco coffee roaster's mission to deliver the perfect cup

description: The birthday tributes have already started for Jimmy Carter, who will turn 100 this Tuesday. They celebrate a lifetime of service to others. The Carter family gave Mark Strassman a unique glipmse into the former president's long life.
title: Jimmy Carter, America's oldest living president ever, turns 100

description: Hamas' leader in Lebanon is the latest Palestinian militant group commander killed there by Israeli airstrikes in recent days, including Hezbollah's longtime chief, Hassan Nasrallah.
title: Hamas leader in Lebanon killed in Israeli airstrike
